description: Mammography is the process of using low-energy X-rays to examine the human breast for diagnosis and screening.
Pregnancy tests may be used to predict if a pregnancy is likely to continue or is abnormal.
Surgery is a medical or dental specialty that uses operative manual and instrumental techniques on a person to investigate or treat a pathological condition.
Fertility is the quality of being able to produce offspring through reproduction following the onset of sexual maturity.

Physical medicine and rehabilitation, also known as physiatry, is a branch of medicine that aims to enhance and restore functional ability and quality of life to people with physical impairments or disabilities
Massage is a general term for pressing, rubbing and manipulating your skin, muscles, tendons and ligaments.
